text:
You don't need a `Project.toml` ; if there is one, Franklin will try to activate the environment; and then it can have the compat bounds you want. The `Project.toml` is mostly useful when deploying the website using GitHub in which case you have to be specific about the env that GitHub will need to re-build your website.

Re "breaking your website"; most current users either deploy locally and push their local files (in which case they fully control what version of Franklin they're using by just specifying that in their env) or they (can) fix it in the `deploy.yml` ; this is what *was* done for the julialang website for instance where the versions is fixed and bumped up from time to time (someone removed the cap recently, I might put it back)
